September 27, 1956
Mr. Robert M. Reed
1106 South Lincoln
Ann Arbor, Michigan
Dear Mr. Reedi
In answer to your recent coranunlcation, we would like to give you information
regarding membership in the national Association of Educational Broadcasters.
The RAEB has three categories of membership, as follows t
Active - Educational institutions, public service organizations, etc. owning
and operating their own radio and/or television stations.
Associate - Institutions (as above) not owning stations, but operating
./ production centers and regularly producing programs over a
comorcial outlet.
Affiliate — Any organization or individual interested in the general furtherance
of educational broadcasting.
For Active members with radio stations, dues in the association are based on rated
transmitter power, as follows!
Class A - 5 kw and over - 190.00
Class R - 1 - 4.9 kw - 25.00
Class C - less than 1 kw- 15.00
Television stations with less than 5 kw video power pay $50.00 and those with 5 kw
or more video power pay $100.00.
Associate and Affiliate noafcars pay $10.00 a year. For this fee members receive
our monthly Newsletter; the various reports and surveys we publish periodically;
services of our Flacemnt Service, television engineer, legal counsel, management
consultant, etc.; plus the normal day to day services, information, and advice that
any national organization gives its members. Under separate cover we are sending
you samples of some of the materials we regularly send our members, plus other items
which will give you macro information about the Association. Of course. Associate
and Affiliate members do not receive as many of these materials as regularly as
Active members do.
